AboutSection.title: More Than a Doctor: A Guide, A Friend
AboutSection.p1: My life journey, which began on the morning of October 10, 1971, in Mersin, led me to a desire to help people and witness their greatest joys. As a mother of two, I feel the indescribable excitement of starting a family and the miracle of every child deep in my heart. This feeling forms the foundation of my passion for my profession and my commitment to my patients.
AboutSection.p2: My medical education, which began at Hacettepe University and was completed with my specialization at Ege University, gave me the opportunity to walk in the light of science. However, I know that medicine is not just about science; it is also about compassion, understanding, and trust.

ServicesSection.title: Our Services
ServicesSection.ivfDescription: Advanced technology and personalized approaches to IVF treatment.

AboutPage.headerTitle: Get to Know Dr. Ayşin Akdoğan
AboutPage.headerDescription: With over 25 years of experience in assisted reproductive technologies, infertility treatment, and women's health, I offer personalized, compassionate, and comprehensive healthcare for every patient in the light of modern medicine.
AboutPage.timelineEge: Ege University Family Planning Research and Application Center
AboutPage.specializationsTitle: Areas of Expertise and Treatment Methods
AboutPage.specializationsDescription: With my extensive experience, I offer comprehensive services in women's health, infertility, and assisted reproductive technologies.
AboutPage.publicationsDescription: I contribute to scientific advancement through internationally recognized publications, book chapters, and clinical research.
AboutPage.internationalDescription: Articles published in prestigious journals such as Fertility & Sterility and the European Journal of Obstetrics & Gynecology.
AboutPage.nationalDescription: Research contributing to the national medical literature in journals such as Turkiye Klinikleri and Ege Tıp Dergisi.
AboutPage.booksDescription: Chapters written for leading textbooks in the field and significant translations.
AboutPage.contactTitle: By Your Side on Your Health Journey
AboutPage.contactDescription: With 25 years of experience and a modern medical approach, I create the most suitable treatment plan for each of my patients and continue to be by your side on this journey.

ServicesPage.title: Our Services
ServicesPage.description: Discover the modern and personalized treatment approaches I offer in the field of women's health and reproductive medicine with over 25 years of experience.
ServicesPage.conditionsDescription: I am at your service with up-to-date diagnosis and treatment methods in the following areas and more.
ServicesPage.treatmentsDescription: The main treatment methods applied with the latest technology and evidence-based approaches.

descriptions.infertility: The condition of not being able to conceive despite one year (6 months for women over 35) of regular, unprotected sexual intercourse. It can affect about 20% of couples.
descriptions.pcos: One of the most common causes of ovulation problems. It is characterized by menstrual irregularities, hormonal imbalances, and the formation of multiple small cysts in the ovaries.
descriptions.endometriosis: A condition in which the endometrium tissue that lines the inside of the uterus grows outside the uterus (ovaries, fallopian tubes, etc.). It can cause chronic pain and infertility.
descriptions.diminishedOvarianReserve: A decrease in the number and quality of a woman's eggs in the ovaries, usually due to advanced age. This condition can naturally reduce the chances of pregnancy.
descriptions.tubalBlockage: Blockage of the fallopian tubes due to past infections or surgeries, which prevents the sperm and egg from meeting, causing infertility.
descriptions.uterineAnomalies: Congenital or acquired structural abnormalities such as fibroids, polyps, intrauterine adhesions, or a uterine septum. They can prevent the embryo from implanting.
descriptions.hypogonadotropicHypogonadism: A condition in which there is no ovulation function due to insufficient secretion of the hormones FSH and LH from the brain (pituitary and hypothalamus) that stimulate the ovaries.
descriptions.ivf: IVF, which is an in-vitro fertilization process, is the most effective treatment method for many couples. It is based on creating an embryo in the laboratory and transferring it to the uterus.
descriptions.aiEmbryoSelection: The most advanced technology that allows the selection of the embryo with the highest implantation potential by analyzing thousands of images obtained with the Embryoscope using artificial intelligence algorithms.
descriptions.icsi: This method, in which a single sperm is injected directly into the egg, greatly increases fertilization rates, especially in male factor infertility.
descriptions.embryoscope: A special incubator system that continuously monitors the development of embryos 24/7. It allows for the selection of the healthiest embryo.
descriptions.pgt: The genetic examination of embryos in couples at risk of genetic diseases or with recurrent IVF failures, so that healthy ones can be transferred.
descriptions.eggFreezing: The freezing and storage of eggs for women with low ovarian reserve or who will undergo cancer treatment to preserve their fertility for the future.

PatientGuidePage.title: Patient Guide
PatientGuidePage.description: Resources, tools, and answers to frequently asked questions about your treatment process.
PatientGuidePage.journeyDescription: Each patient's story and needs are different. Let's map out the most suitable treatment path for you together.
PatientGuidePage.infertilityStep1Description: A medical history is taken from both partners simultaneously, a gynecological examination is performed, and the treatment process is planned.
PatientGuidePage.infertilityStep2Description: Basic tests such as AMH, blood count, thyroid tests, and Pap smear for the woman, and a sperm analysis for the man are requested. If necessary, a hysterosalpingogram (HSG) or advanced surgery (hysteroscopy/laparoscopy) is planned.
PatientGuidePage.infertilityStep3Description: The cause of infertility (e.g., ovulation problems, tubal factor, male factor) is determined based on the test results, and a personalized treatment roadmap is drawn up for you.
PatientGuidePage.infertilityStep4Description: The most suitable method for you, such as Intrauterine Insemination (IUI) or In Vitro Fertilization (IVF), is decided upon together, taking into account success rates and your individual situation.
PatientGuidePage.ivfStep1Description: We aim to develop multiple high-quality eggs (follicles) with hormone injections that usually start on the 2nd or 3rd day of the menstrual cycle and last for about 8-12 days. The process is closely monitored with ultrasound and hormone tests.
PatientGuidePage.ivfStep2Description: When the follicles reach a sufficient size, a maturation injection is given, and 35-37 hours later, the eggs are collected in a 15-20 minute procedure under light anesthesia.
PatientGuidePage.ivfStep3Description: The collected eggs are fertilized with sperm cells in the laboratory using the microinjection (ICSI) method. The fertilized embryos are monitored for 3 to 5 days in special incubators (Embryoscope) to track their development.
PatientGuidePage.ivfStep4Description: The highest quality embryo or embryos are selected and placed inside the uterus in a painless and simple procedure under ultrasound guidance. Additional methods such as embryo glue can be used at this stage.
PatientGuidePage.ivfStep5Description: A blood pregnancy test (Beta-hCG) is performed 12-14 days after the embryo transfer to determine if the result is positive. In case of a positive result, pregnancy follow-up begins.
PatientGuidePage.gettingStartedDescription: Please follow the steps below carefully to avoid any disruptions in your treatment.
documentsList: One passport-sized photograph for each partner
Consent forms to be read and signed at our clinic
notesList: Diligently follow the prescribed medications and other instructions.
It is important to obtain your medications before starting the treatment.
PatientGuidePage.finalNote: Remember; all our efforts are for you to achieve a healthy pregnancy. It is important for us to follow a 'Patient-Friendly' treatment policy that respects your right to all kinds of information.
PatientGuidePage.dueDateInfo: This tool uses the Parikh Formula to calculate your estimated due date based on your last menstrual period (LMP) and average menstrual cycle length. This provides a more accurate result for women who do not have a standard 28-day cycle.
PatientGuidePage.ovulationInfo: This tool works on the principle that ovulation usually occurs 14 days before the next menstrual period. It estimates your most fertile days based on the last menstrual period and cycle length you enter.
PatientGuidePage.disclaimer: This calculation is an estimate. For precise results, ovulation test kits or a doctor's examination is recommended.
